thread.title: Roundup: Mount Olive clinches third straight title
thread.title_full: Roundup: Mount Olive clinches third straight title

title: Roundup: Mount Olive clinches third straight title
text:
Roundup: Mount Olive clinches third straight title Staff Reports 9:43 p.m. EDT October 22, 2015 Mount Olive senior goalkeeper Tim Watral throws the ball back into play. (Photo: Alexandra Pais/Correspondent) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Senior Hugo Almeida scored twice as Mount Olive defeated Morris Hills, 3-0, on Thursday afternoon to clinch the third straight NJAC-American title. Tim Watral and Brett Siegel teamed up for five saves and Mount Olive's 13th shutout. 
Randolph 1, Mendham 0: Randolph midfielder Walter Zuniga scored the lone goal on a 45-yard free kick. Evan Miele made eight saves for his sixth shutout (11-3-1). 
Delbarton 5, West Morris 0: Junior goalkeeper Santiago Robertson-Lavelle earned Delbarton's 15th shutout without making a save. 
Newton 4, Kittatinny 0: Tanner Euston made four saves for his fifth shutout. 
Girls soccer 
Morristown-Beard 1, Newark Academy 0: Senior Dani Kabat scored as Morristown-Beard won a Prep B quarterfinal, its seventh straight victory. Lizzy Sengel made five saves for the Crimson's seventh shutout. 
Chatham 3, Morris Knolls 1: Kelsey Terry of Chatham (3-9-1) converted a 25-yard free kick. Kelly Huber scored a first-half goal for host Morris Knolls (3-9-1). 
Montville 1, Parsippany Hills 0: Sophomore Halle Fiedler scored the lone goal in the first half. Montville sophomore Victoria Scarratt made 10 saves for the shutout (10-9). 
Pope John 3, Sparta 1: Junior forward Lindsey Healy had a goal and two assists in the NJAC-American match. Carly Seeland scored a second-half goal for Sparta (13-3). 
Field hockey 
Boonton 2, Butler 0: Sophomore Michelle Tolchko and senior Kasey Thomas scored for host Boonton (7-7-3). 
Newton 1, Wallkill Valley 1 (OT): Sophomore Morgan Carr tallied in the first half for Wallkill Valley (8-8-3). Newton senior midfielder Jordan Coiro tied the score in the second half of the NJAC-Colonial game. 
Volleyball 
West Morris 2, Roxbury 0 (25-22, 25-9): West Morris (20-0): Katie O'Keefe 6 kills, 2 digs; Danielle Wohning 3 kills, block, 4 digs, 3 aces; Roxbury (15-5): Kate Shirkey 11 assists, block, 5 digs; Joelle Marston 2 kills, block. 
Tennis 
Chatham 5, Morristown 0: Singles: Lana DePasquale (C) def. Rachel Alhmeyer 6-1, 6-4; Elana Tognola (C) def. Rachel Haberman 6-2, 6-1; Julia Gallop (C) def. Juliet Minor 6-0, 6-0 ; Doubles: Jen McCann and Abby Morgan (C) def. and 6-0, 6-0; Carly Pento and Kristen Marqueen (C) def. Rachel Saleh and Esmeralda Prudencio 6-0, 6-0. Team records: Chatham 13-4, Morristown 10-11. 
Sussex Tech 4, Wallkill Valley 1: Singles: Maria Stere (ST) def. Sheridan Formoso 6-1, 6-0; Marisa Puzina (ST) def. Mackenzie Gibson 6-1, 6-0; Alicia Martin-Conyers (ST) def. Maddie Hook 6-1, 6-0 ; Doubles: Domenique Bevacqua and Emma Noury (ST) def. Madison Gerisch and Katie Smith 6-3, 6-2 ; Rebecca Shepherd and Katie Smith (WV) def. Danielle Nussberger and Deanna Nussberger 6-3, 6-4. Team records: Sussex Tech 16-1, Wallkill Valley 1-17. Read or Share this story: http://dailyre.co/1RZWteQ TOP VIDEOS
